poem:
Folklore Dynamics

In Venice, dancers weave
ancient rhythms, 
swift currents of bodies,
mid-career, neither dawn
nor twilight,
hands carved by years.
Beneath arches and bridges,
present blooms in leaps,
where time itself
pauses,
listening
to the pulse
of possibility,
as new steps 
stitch the old waters.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Venice Dance Biennale: There Was Still Time; Folklore Dynamics review – full of ideas and intent One of Wayne McGregor’s innovations as artistic director of the Venice Dance Biennale – a position he will continue to hold for the next two years – was to introduce an open call for work by Italian choreographers. The commission aims to support dance-makers in the tricky mid-period of their careers, when they are neither rising stars nor established". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Venice Dance Biennale: There Was Still Time; Folklore Dynamics review – full of ideas and intent One of Wayne McGregor’s innovations as artistic director of the Venice Dance Biennale – a position he will continue to hold for the next two years – was to introduce an open call for work by Italian choreographers. The commission aims to support dance-makers in the tricky mid-period of their careers, when they are neither rising stars nor established
